description:
My secret friend! You were absolutely correct about this discreet Starbucks! I'm so glad we found it in the dark! lol Yay for being opened early this weekend morning. Otherwise we would have had to change our plans. 

NF PSL was great. I really should have ordered a medium sized one though. Small was way too tiny!!!

Thank goodness for clean washrooms. Parking is at a disadvantage here though but we were fortunate to find street parking. One could even walk from the Palace of Fine Arts. That's walkable too! Yay bucket list completed! Actually several! Woot woot!
author: Karen K.

description:
This is most likely my favorite Starbucks in the US. Despite the fact it is not a Reserve location, I still like it. Starbucks are 2 kinds: Starbucks or Starbucks Reserve. Reserve locations are the fancy ones and they have stuff I really like. Like the Jamaican, Ethiopian, Sumatran roasts and other selections.  

I saw many negative reviews about this place judging from one time encounter for the most part. If I were a business owner, I would freak out!. Even if you create the ideal perfect business in the cosmos, there will be still whining negatively-charged snappy people complaining and giving bad ratings. It's inevitable. 

If you're local, you won't appreciate it. I'm an ex-citizen of SF and I respect the beauty of this location. I mean look, this Starbucks is the closest SB to the Golden Gate Bridge, the most handsome bridge in the world. Walking 2 miles from this SB to the red bridge is one of the best things you can do in SF (after eating Chinese chicken wings at San Tung). It's located at the entrance of the Presidio, the gorgeous green hilly hippie ultimate recreation hub national park in a city setting I know of. And it's next door to The Palace of Fine Art. And it has a Yoda fountain in its front yard. And and and. What else do you want!! Even if those baristas are 5-10 minutes late to give you your coffee, just go out and breathe some fresh Pacific air mixed with eucalyptus trees fragrance rather than being pissed. Yes, their staff were sometimes snippy and snooty but you're in SF, man! I mean even the homeless guys at GGP can be snobs. It is awesome to have friendly baristas. A smile can make someone's day. But whatever man! I used to study for my board exam here. So I came here probably more than 60-70 times! And to date, I still stop here almost every time checking in SF.


Try the Milan-inspired CORDUSIO drink. It's a little bit amazing!! I usually get boring black coffee medium-dark roast. But this Cordusio is really good. It's espresso mocha.





.
author: Ahmad A.

description:
#83! I was very surprised to find out when you Yelp "Starbucks in San Francisco" this particular location comes up as number 83! Granted it is not in a particularly high traffic area and it is a bit hidden in that you have to know about the location ! But it is in the most beautiful surroundings of any  Starbucks to which I have ever been. Smack dab in the Presidio bordering the Marina District of SF. Think beautiful water features, lots of trees, greenery... nothing short of feeling like you have been transported to a Zen meditation retreat! I could also describe it as a very, very mini Japanese Tea Garden feel (without the admission fee) if you have ever visited that beautiful place in San Francisco.  I am usually here on weekends so the hustle and bustle of the 8 to 5 work routine is nonexistent. I read a lot of the Yelp reviewers make note of the high volume traffic at this Starbucks during work hours... Monday through Friday. And I surmise from that, and their one star reviews, that it can get pretty ugly :-) ..lots of people wanting their coffee with stressed out Baristas. So my solid 5-star review is based on visiting this particular Starbucks during weekends and holidays.

If you find yourself wandering around the Marina District near the Palace of Fine Arts and you want a quiet moment and a cup of coffee ... treat yourself with this beautiful park-like setting.  Dog friendly and kid friendly ....both the Starbucks and the park :-). You can enjoy the Starbucks' outside or indoor seating but I prefer to wander the park and find a bench where I can bask in nature and the beauty of it all.  

Also noteworthy... the restrooms in the Starbucks' building are really, really nice!!! And no codes....you don't even have to enter the Starbucks to use the restrooms (men and women).... shhh...secret!
author: Lizz Z.

description: The variability in service and customers here is a little disorienting, especially given its location at the Presidio. There are too many other Starbucks cafes to comment further or plan a return trip to this one.
author: Christine T.

description:
I come here regularly and it's always busy. Today it's a light morning with probably 10 customers and 3 workers. 

While I like the ambience, I've got today that this Starbucks has lost its luster with me. 

This is  not the local, small friendly days of past. No hello, no thank you. What do you want? Anything else? Barney would definitely not stand for this Starbucks. What happened to "Please and Thank you?"
author: David C.

description:
This branch is in kind of nature.Presidio.Beautiful spot in the city.My work is very close to this branch.I often being here early mornings.EARLY MORNINGS.But there is a huge problem in there.MUSIC.it is very unnecessary and very loud shi?y pop music.Common where is common sense.I don't think anybody wants to listen that kind of sh?t music and that loud.Literally, it ruins my day.You can ask why don't you want to go to other branches or cafes.I like Starbucks coffee and this branch is the only choice that I have.it's because right next to my work.
Somebody has to thake care of this issue.
author: Metalmonarch Y.

description:
5 for ambiance in one of the prettiest settings you can have a Starbucks. 
3.5 for the average coffee but you know that going into the shop. 

The low score is for the service. The place can get really busy and the Marina which I lived in as a kid can be filled with douche/pushy people so I give the staff somewhat of a pass.

On my 3rd visit I showed up at 5:30 when it opened. I grabbed a couple of plastic wrapped packages of chocolate chip cookies from a large basket  on the counter and asked for the price. A bald guy who I think was the manager then began to speak loudly to me I wasn't suppose to touch them. I apologized put them back into the basket. He then continued to berate me because he now had to throw the batch etc etc. 

For the next hour he was short and surly at the register. 

I had made a mistake, maybe things aren't going well for him outside work but Starbucks is a food service industry.
author: Joe B.

description: This was my first encounter with this Starbucks and to say it was disappointing is an understatement. I called a week in advance to reserve a gallon of coffee for an office event, I confirmed the time, date and pickup name several times before hanging up. We had the event yesterday and when I went to pick up the coffee they had no recollection of the order. Incredibly disappointed with their lack of attention to detail and follow through.
author: Kathleen M.

description: By far my favorite Starbucks to go to. I've read many of the reviews down here and it's clear that the customer is wrong. As always. How ya gonna give two stars for the music? That's a corporate thing, David. You're not mad about the service or drink.. you're mad about the music. Incredible.
author: Vu N.

description: I just love this Starbucks! It is in such a beautiful garden setting, has plenty of seating (indoor and outdoor) and has nice staff/baristas. I don't review many Starbucks locations (and I also don't frequent them because I prefer local coffee, but I like that you know what you're getting with Starbucks!). This one is  a 20 minute walk from my home and I find myself here more than I ever imagined because it's so peaceful!
author: Shelley V.

description: This Starbucks can be a bit of a challenge to get to and that's a good thing because it would be even more crowded than it already is. I go here to catch up on paperwork when I'm in San Francisco.  Indoor and outdoor seating. When I get tired I go lay under a tree and look out at the Academy of Arts pavilion. The Presidio is one of SFs greatest features IMO.
author: J T.

description: This is absolutely my favorite Starbucks in the nation. Believe me, I've been to a ton; from Alaska to Wisconsin, this is by far the best. Service was absolutely fantastic. To be quite honest, the best service comes from a goddess-like appearance named Annalise. If I'm having a terrible day, she makes everything brighter. She is truly the light of my world. I only come to this same exact Starbucks because she truly gets my drink down. She knows my order as soon as I walk into the door. What great customer service! 15/10 would recommend this place. There is nothing like this location. Truly, truly spectacular!
author: Cindy D.

description:
Picture it: I walk into this Starbucks wanting my usual. My usual which involves blending coffee and sugar and ice together to create a magnificent scrumptious enchantment of caffeine, a resonance of pure bliss, turning dragons into kittens, akin to gold for the soul.

And all the blenders are broken. 

Because hell is real folks, hell is real.
author: Meg T.

description:
Views: good. Convenience: good. 

Alternatives: presidio social club and other places on Chestnut.

We live and work in the area for the past 10 years and this had always been the place where I took investor meetings and interview after a jog. Today, we went with a friend and had a big meal before that so my husband just ordered a big ice tea and he asked for waters for us. The staff only gave us one so I figure he was too busy I can just grab an empty cup from the no line register and even hand it up as asking for it and intended to share the tab water with my friend. Another staff - Jenn yelled at me "you're not supposed to do that, can't just grab a cup. Your guy asked for a water only" and gave me a dirty look. Wow really after all this time being the place mostly serving all the important and richest people in the building, Jenn still think it's a bright idea to tell a paid customer that they can't have an empty cup over zillions time of over paid ice tea???! 

I really hope she think so important of herself and get promoted because then this Starbucks would really go out of business. I'm running a consumer startup and this is definitely a lesson of how to prevent your customer not leaving you and taking other people to leave you. Thanks Jenn for a valuable lesson!
author: MS T.

description:
Probably the best kept secret of this city - the Starbucks in the Presidio!

Not gonna tell where it is, but it makes for a perfect stop on your Sunday stroll, surrounded by trees and meadows. It even has an outdoor area for the sunny days (yes, sunny days), and, for your convenience, a restroom that is not locked by a code.

The staff during my visit was very fast, but not really friendly. Oh well, I can forget about that and just enjoy my Grande Pike out there in the sun.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
I love this Starbucks. It's different than the others as it has a lot of seating inside and outside and you can't go wrong being surrounded by the pretty presidio exterior! My bf tends to sit here on the weekends me and my crazy bff go on our semi-annual half marathon runs. What I like about this spot is the bathrooms are also large and clean. Can't beat a place to clean up after a run!

Also folks here tend to not be the stinky kind as my bf has mentioned to me on occasions when he'd have to sit at other SF Starbucks locations where the homeless wander in.
author: Carolen M.

description: Although I'm mad at starbucks for shutting down la boulange, they have quick and convenient spinach feta wraps (which they offer with lil siracha packets now!) Also can't beat the service  here, they're always so awesome! Esp the guy with the cool hair and plugs.
author: Chanel H.

description: Very rude employees. ESPECIALLY PATRICK. I come to this Starbucks almost every weekend to grab a cup of coffee and some desert. A few employees are friendly and professional but the majority are not. Especially the guy named Patrick. You ask him questions and he pretends that he's not listening and completely ignores you. Every time he serves me coffee I tell him thank you and he never responds. The branch has a prime location and view and I would've easily given it 5 stars if I wasn't that pissed with customer service.
author: Amr K.

description: Avg SB. Has decent public restroom; no codes. Very nice and tranquil spot.
author: Yenn T.

description: The location is great and I love most of the staff members, but the bathrooms are always repulsive.  I'm not even a clean person so this says a lot coming from me.  Talked to the supervisor who told me there was nothing he could do. Hopefully this post will help them figure it out.
author: Megan M.

description:
This has to rate as one of the best Starbucks anywhere.  An open secret among locals, you might never think to look for one in this spot, a converted military complex amid the sprawling Presidio, now housing Lucas digital media wizardry among other things.  There's no big green Starbucks sign, just a couple normal signs with arrows directing you to building A, B, C, D -- or Starbucks.  Tell the parking attendant at the gate that's why you're here.

Look for the Yoda fountain to the left of the entrance.  The Force Awakens here -- with the help of a double or quad espresso.  Take your selfie before heading to the rear of the building where coffee awaits.

Grab a rare outdoor table if it's a rare warm sunny day.  Take a stroll on the beautiful grounds and enjoy views of the domed Palace of Fine Arts and beyond.  Pro tip:  It's not a bad walk (less than a mile, easy downhill) down the path to the beach at Crissy Field.

Also, it's a Starbucks, with all that entails.  With parking.  In San Francisco.  Despite rumors to the contrary, it has free wifi ("Google Starbucks").  I make a habit of going to this one every time I find myself in that part of town.  Like many parts of the Presidio and Golden Gate Park, it's a soothing bucolic retreat from the madding city crowds.  Enjoy!
author: Antone J.

description:
Everything is great about this Starbucks... the location inside the Presidio, the interior, but the staff, well to be kind, suck. Almost all of them have a major attitude, more than your average SF barista. Not sure what the issue is, but it's consistently bad. I come here once a week (because I have to; no other nearby coffee in the complex).

Get your coffee without the attitude and sit outside in the lush green of the Presidio, but don't think you're going to be besties with your barista.
author: Karl W.

description: I came in here after visiting the palace of arts building and the initial person that helped us is very nice and friendly. Like always, I get a refill for my coffee by just paying the $.50 refill fee. For some odd reason, the baristas, Latoka and Ruben, refused to give me the refill, even after showing them the refill policy on google. The way she spoke to me was so rude and uncalled for. She raised her voice and was so firm about her decision that it made it embarrassing. After Josh, the manager came back from his break, he agreed that they do have a refill policy and apologized. The baristas still were unapologetic and had the look of annoyance on their faces. I will never go back there again!
author: Joyce H.

description:
The garden around it is very nice. Feels like a country club with the pond, fountain, and river. 
Lots of indoor and outdoor searing.
author: David S.

description:
They're generally friendly here. They get lots of regulars and hook my coworkers up with their regular orders based on memory. I rarely come in for coffee, but I ordered myself a latte while a coworker went to the pickup counter and asked for a cup of water. The barista gave her a big cup, no questions asked. 

I got my latte from the same guy, then I asked him if I could also have a cup of water. He told me I had to order it from the counter, this is policy...policy is policy, but if you're going to bullshit me when you gave the person I walked into the store with no issues, you're just being a jerk. Or maybe it's because I don't have lady parts to tickle your fancy?
author: Aaron Y.

description: This SBUX has a lot of potential with the location, generous seating area (for SF), the park like setting that's quiet and unique near such a busy thoroughfare, but it is ALWAYS dirty. The trash cans are always full, sometimes overflowing, the area where you get napkins, creamer, etc. is always unkempt. It's consistently one of the dirtier Starbucks I've visited. Staff is mostly friendly (including one impossibly always upbeat guy), but the last time I walked in an older barista appeared to be condescendingly berating a staff member. It's too bad because I really want this to be more my neighborhood SBUX than Chestnut.
author: Matthew v.

description:
Beautiful location, really! I've never been to a more perfect spot. Lots of outdoor seating with trees and flowers. BUT, employee management here is horrible. Every time I come in there's a line out the door and only 1 cashier. The workers don't seem to work well together or as a team. It's like 6 individuals are doing their own thing, which impacts the service. For instance...today, there were 10 people in line, 1 cashier, 1 barista and 4 people restocking?!?!? I also swear one of the women working glared at me when I went to get half and half while she was cleaning the counter. Like full on glare... I actually started laughing because, geeze, that's a new experience. Usually the staff is pretty friendly though.

Honestly, I suggest some team building, communication and better management. Efficiency, lol. This Could be a fantastic Starbucks, but severely falls short.
author: Gina C.

description:
This place has character. I redeemed my birthday drink at this Starbucks location last year and boy, did they make it interesting!

When I ordered and showed them my Starbucks app, the cashier said happy birthday, asked for my name and wrote on the cup. Standard procedure. When my drink was ready, the barista yelled out, "Sandy, the birthday girl!" Wide-eyed and confused, I slowly walk over to get my drink. Two random strangers even said, "happy birthday! We're going to embarrass you now!" Aaahhh, *dies-as-I-find-my-seat-and-try-to-act-casual
author: Sandy T.

description:
Love this Starbucks, beautiful location surrounded by greens and quiet neighborhood. 

You get to relax with a cup of coffee here, not like the ones on a busy street downtown where I usually choose to just grab and go.
author: Jennifer Z.

description:
Avoid at all costs. This place is always agonizingly slow, the staff are rude and it's always really messy inside. 

This morning I placed an order for two drinks at 10:30 through the Starbucks order ahead app.  Arrived at 10:40 and asked the barista if she had an online order in my name, to which she flatly and rudely responded "No." I explained to her that I had placed the order 10 minutes ago and could she please check to see if it had come through. She rolled her eyes, checked the tickets and sure enough mine was there. Instead of apologizing for the delay and making the drinks, she continued to make the orders coming in from the cash register ahead of mine. By the time I had my drinks in hand it was 10:50. Understandably things can be delayed if they are super busy, but there weren't that many people in the store and it seemed like she was being purposefully rude. 

Too bad, since this location has parking and a nice garden area. Chestnut St. location is 3x busier all the time and still manages to make mobile orders without issue.
author: Andrea M.

description:
This one is for you Tracy A. You said. "Why on earth would anyone write a review about Starbucks? What is there to write about?" Challenge accepted. :-)

I'm anti Starbucks. Though throughout the years of travel abroad, Starbucks became so ubiquitous that you start to use it as a refuge when you are homesick.  In addition,every conference you go to they give you a gift certificate of $5 Starbucks card. So you keep on reminding yourself that you must use them but you can't bring yourself to a Starbucks. 

Thus, this is a rare occasion to sing praises of this coffee giant based in Seattle. It's the location that made the difference. 

Park on Broadway, skip the Lyon Street Stairs, walk through the Presidio, and you are at this Starbucks in less than half an mile. More ambitious walkers / runners should start from Golden Gate Park, then pass through the chaotic Clement and then enter on the side of on 9th and Lake into the Presidio, then continue on down through Presidio and you end up near Lombard and Legion of Honor. A great route. Except one should always plan for a pit stop. Enter this Starbucks. It's strategically located. You can get a bathroom break, free wifi and coffee and things before completing your running/walking route. Take a look at this Building C while at it. Every firm inside of this building seems to be a private equity firm. Interesting. Long table is excellent for doing your scavenger hunt strategy session.  We were on foot and did not know what it was. It was the annual play-dash day. It started there. There were two teams of five occupying the long table. The game went all the way to Marina Green.  I ended up chatting up with that organizer who choose this very Starbucks as the beginning of the route. He also ended it there as well. 

The building is very airy and warm, it faces a huge green lawn, and it felt like you are out and about (which you are until that very moment of coming inside of Building C) and so close to the nature. When did Presidio go upscale? Always living in the shadow of the GGP, it's so very much under appreciated. Now, you don't have to worry about that bathroom break you've been dreading about any more. While at it, get yourself a cup of Americano before you head to Crissy Fields. It gets windy. You will need a warm drink on hand. 

I never saw the Yoda statue but there was a statue of Philo T. Farnsworth, aka the guy who invented TV right next to it,  this particular statue in the Presidio by the Starbucks garnished a nice review on NYT three years back. Don't miss it. 

An added bonus. A great date place. There is a man made pond just down the green lawn. Grab your coffee and things, head to the pond, watch the duckies, and then sit on the bench while holding hands, admiring the pink spring flowers in bloom on the tall branches. You are almost always alone, and it's almost guaranteed to be romantic. All that for just $3 / cup of coffee. 

You may actually grow to like Starbucks.
author: Victoria E.

description: Chai was bad and the girl who took my order was rude. I know it's Starbucks and all but customer service is important. Down with the big corporations.
author: Gina B.

description:
Check out my review video at the link below: 
https://youtu.be/6YaqOQLjj1c?list=PLq78Di1KnrrO-BT2_haZae1-_-gJfM_Xk

Are you looking for a place to escape the congested city streets of San Francisco?

Are you interested in taking in some peacefully scenic views of the Palace of Fine Arts over a soothing cup of tea? 

Well look no further than Starbucks in the Presidio. 

Located in the historic Presidio neighborhood, this run-of-the-mill coffee shop is anything but ordinary. 

Starbucks in the Presidio is one of my favorite first or second date locations. 

First of all, the Presidio is a gorgeous national park with a rich and vibrant heritage. The preserved military homes and office buildings add nostalgic nuances of American history. 

Grab a coffee you can count on from Starbucks and enjoy inside or outside seating options with many places to explore if you want to keep your date active. 

The reason I love it for a first date is because there is ample free-parking options, the baristas are always nice, the service is quick, and the bathrooms are spacious and clean. 

But there's much more to it than just that. The park's oversized evergreen trees help maintain a crisp freshness in the air, guaranteed to keep your date alert and energized. 

Exploring the Presidio's lush greenery, serene stone ponds, and woodsy hiking trails stimulates endorphins and escalates pair bonding. 

Being in nature engages the senses which helps to replace logic with emotion, a major factor in creating chemistry and stimulating sexual attraction.

The rolling green hills of the Presidio and expansive grassy nulls are likely to activate happy childhood memories of easy-going summers spent at the park with family. 

Take a peaceful walk through the tranquil water garden and share stories of the days you spent when you were younger, playing outdoors with your friends in the warm summer heat. 

The only down side? If you're taking public transportation this location is far away from BART and MUNI but you can get there by bus and it's well worth the trip if you've never been. 

And now you know why Starbucks in the Presidio is anything but your average coffee date.

Park Here For Free:
1007 General Kennedy Ave
San Francisco, CA 94129

Or Park Here For Free:
1076 Gorgas Ave
San Francisco, CA 94123

Or Park Here For Free:
1031 Edie Rd
San Francisco, CA 94129
author: Emyli V.

description: The customer service attitude here is terrible. No greetings at all from the cashiers. They also ask you in a rude way if what you want: "so what do you want?" Afterward, when I did not fine the straws on the counter, I was trying to find the straws at the register and I was told by the cashier that "you don't reach over here!" What a rude way they talk to their customers. I never thought a Starbucks would offer such terrible customer service.
author: Jackson C.

description:
I only order Salted Caramel Hot Chocolate whenever I goes to Starbucks, and their barista at this location got it perfect! Not too sweet, not too salty. This location is really nice too!

On the other hand, the exact same drink from another Starbucks location here in Oakland was overly sweet with lots of caramel syrup left at the bottom of my cup. Sad face. :(
author: YY M.

description:
I work at the same building and go to this Starbucks very often .
I love people who work here - always nice, always fast, always perfect orders. 

But I want to give a big thank to them for a perfect and on time pre-order. Great job, guys!

This Starbucks is the best in the city!
author: Jenna F.

description: My husband works in the same building as this Starbucks, so we stop here occasionally. The plus is the location - you can grab a coffee and walk down to the beautiful view and man-made lake (? is that what you call it?).  The drinks are standard, and when we last came the tables were a bit dirty and the trash cans were full.  But other than that, this is a typical Starbucks.
author: Tracy L.

description: To amend my previous review, the service here has improved immensely! The baristas are always quick-footed and polite, unlike the surly service before.
author: Tina K.

description:
What a darling little gem in the Presidio! 

I absolutely love stopping by here after a jog on Ecology trail and sipping an Americano with a side of ice water. 

The seating is fantastic with plenty of seats available outdoors which is perfect on a sunny warm day to people and dog watch.
author: Court S.

description: Great customer service. I ordered a vanilla sweet cream cold brew and the barista originally made me a regular cold brew but a different barista kindly helped me add the cream when I asked about it. Nice outdoor seating area that overlooks the palace of fine arts. Plentiful accessible outlets and the tables even had wireless charging stations. The bathroom (at least the women's one) could be more clean.
author: Wendy C.

description:
Two words: Google Starbucks.   It has it.   60 Mbps vs. 2 Mbps Wifi.   There is no real choice.   Avoid any Starbucks that just has AT&T service as it is capped at around 2-3 Mbps per user.   And no, that is not because lots of people may be using it.   Even when you go to AT&T Starbucks with no leechers, no laptops, no customers, it is still 2 Mbps.   When there are a lot of users or signal fragmentation, AT&T wifi can drop to abysmal rates of less than half a Mbps and noticable lag even on simple non-streaming  web page loads.

Unfortunately, there are only 10 Starbucks in San Francisco with Google Wifi.   But this store is one of them, and it's like a jewel mounted in the golden setting of the Park Presidio.  

Actually 10 Google Starbucks in one city is a lot.   Most cities only have 1 Starbucks with fast wifi.   I guess San Francisco lucks out because there are so many techies around demanding speed.   Come on people, send Starbucks a message.   Don't patronize their outlets that only serve up 2 Mbps when 60 Mbps could be had with a little customer awareness and selectivity.
author: Trevor C.

description:
Ooooh love this location!!
it's beautiful and peaceful! Too bad I only found out about this 8 months after moving to Marina. This is gonna be my go-to coffee shop to work and relax :)!!
author: Mina D.

description:
Not just any Starbucks...this particular one is located within George Lucas's Letterman Center and caters to the people who work for Lucasfilm, ILM, and Lucasarts - I guess the Star Wars toys and trinkets that adorn a good area of the front area really give that away. 

Still, the baristas are really nice, the place is clean and beautiful, and the park nearby is gorgeous...I loved grabbing a iced white chocolate mocha and taking pictures of the golden gate bridge in the distance.
author: Albert L.

description:
This is the worst Starbucks I have ever been to and I travel monthly. Mike had the WORST customer service. As a early morning barista, you should have the patience and the personality to handle a small line of morning people. Mike was making hand gestures telling me to hurry up and didn't even give me my food warmed like I asked. He was getting mad at the computer for not being fast enough and i watched as my bill went up to $19 because he kept clicking the screen HARD. Then I had to wait for him to fix it. When my boyfriend gave him back the food saying I asked for it warmed, Mike argued back saying "no she didn't. Next time you better tell us right when you buy it". Now I was not dressed proper like all these business people because I was traveling from a backpacking trip. I felt mistreated because I looked like a bum compared to the rest of the customers. 

Here's the best part- MIKE IS THE MANAGER. I work in customer service and this is the worst I've seen. 
I really hope the district manager fires this one. Without a doubt this Mike was a mistake.
author: Rhazlynn C.

description: In response to my ordering a menu item currently listed on the menu but apparently no longer available, I was told: "Nope. Not available." When I pointed out it was on the menu, I was told: "We are not in control of our menu. Never have been." I assume this means that your corporate body controls the pre-printed menu signs, but a little kindness and a smile would go a long way. Perhaps suggest a similar drink? Heaven forbid, apologize for no longer having the item? Great customer service is still a thing loyal customers enjoy - FYI.
author: Stephanie K.

description:
I've been here a few times, and each time I seem to be having worst service then the time before. The employees don't listen, and seem to be more interested in being your BFF then taking my order, and half the time it was slightly wrong. The refrigerated section had virtually nothing and they are always out of stock on most items. They also mentioned to me one time that they ran out of whip cream, how is that possible? It's also REALLY loud and crowded. 

On a plus, the location is beautiful and the patio is really nice.
author: Rachel A.

description:
This Starbucks is on the Lucasfilms HQ campus in the Presidio.  It has plenty of indoor and outdoor seating. Views sitting outdoor are beautiful.  You can even see the Palace of Fine Arts from here.

The staff was friendly and service was fast.  The bathrooms here are also clean when we came in here for a pit stop.

We didn't stay long to actually sit and rest, but if you are in the area and need a caffeine fix, this is your go to place!
author: Janet E.

description:
It's a Starbucks with a nice view with its best feature being a nice large balcony outside for a pleasant outdoor experience, when it's sunny.

Only a couple of comfy chairs. Pleasant crew as most of them have. Best thing about this one is the proximity to the Yoda statue just round the corner.
author: Pantera W.

description:
My most favorite starbucks, amazing location and the great usual coffee!!

Do try this place for the great view of the golden gate bridge nearby by taking a stroll on the campus and also the place has a statue of Yoda! Must visit place whenever schedule permits
author: Kunal S.

description:
Located inside the Presidio, there's parking within walking distance but not adjacent to the store. Cute patio area that looks into greens of the park. Wifi is from Google so a lot better than locations with AT&T.

Came across this Starbucks in search for the Yoda Fountain (It ended up being right around the corner). BF got the Iced Lemonade since he was thirsty from trekking around in circles (He didn't want to use our phones to get GPS directions to the statue because he wanted to "explore" and discover it). The lemonade wasn't too tart or sweet. A lot of ice though. Still a very pretty location.
author: Kitty K.

description:
7 employees behind the counter and they are totally disorganized.

Not making Frappuccinos (didn't say why) but why can they be making smoothies? Slow service and confused employees.
author: P S.

description: Can the crew at Starbucks Presidio be any more thoughtful and downright awesome? They gave my husband a cute little onesie for my soon to be newborn with a cartoon of Darth Vader wielding a light saber. Caption: Sith in training! Love it. Thank you!
author: Pam C.

description: Super nice environment but I was disappointed about the customer service.  I ordered a grande soy chai with no foam and a peach green tea lemonade with light ice.  Those are my usual drinks and I never had any problems ordering them at any Starbucks but here.  The barista first filled the whole cup with ice and I had to tell her I ordered light ice.  She ignored me and I had to say it again I wanted light ice.  So the guy behind her had to tell her to throw away some ice and up to where she had to fill with the green tea.  Then I saw foam in the chai tea latte and I said to her that I wanted no foam.  Without any apology or any sort, she scooped the form and filled it with more milk.  I tasted it and I could hardly taste any chai.  I told her and she said there was chai in there.  I said, "I'm sorry, I really couldn't taste any chai."  She reluctantly took it back and put two pumps of chai in my drink.  I told myself I most likely would never come back here.
author: Rina L.

description: Great Starbucks location!! I love the old fashioned donut with a cup of hot chai tea. The baristas are very nice and helpful and FAST!! I never have a problem with going in and  out either. Very fast service!
author: Sandra P.

description: Great public seating. HORRIBLE, DIRTY BATHROOMS. I politely informed the staff but they seemed annoyed that I mentioned it (bathroom is really dirty and no paper towels). I informed them so 1) the other customers after me could have a clean bathroom to use, and 2) the EMPLOYEES MAKING BEVERAGES could have clean hands and not use a dirty bathroom before serving food to the public.  SMH
author: K S.

description:
I have to say I have experienced the worst customer interaction here than at any other restaurant/ coffee shop/ bar etc.  The red bearded employee is forcefully rude, aggressive, and condescending. Every time I go in and he is working, I want to leave.  He makes totally inappropriate comments and it is honestly shocking that he is allowed to treat customers the way he does.

All the other employees are great, and as with almost any Starbucks their drinks are awesome.
author: Liz M.

description: I'm a regular customer who regularly buys pastries on my way to work in the area. The customer service has always been good except this particular morning. I went in to buy a bagel and cream cheese toasted, orange juice, and a sandwich for lunch (for later). I also asked for a bag for my items. The cashier handed me the bag without placing the items in it, so I had to bag my own items. I was real surprised by that action and thought that wasn't "customer centered". I don't know if the cashier is new or just wasn't in his right mind. Customer service is an art with in it self!
author: Tee J.

description:
My favorite Starbucks in the city.. unless it's after 7pm.

If you don't live nearby, the view alone makes this Starbucks worthy of a visit.

- Friendly staff (don't forget to tip your barista!)
- Great, inspiring views
- Good pit stop during my daily walk/jog when I lived in Pac Heights
- Located in my favorite park for reading/relaxing
- Extremely comfortable
- Cleanest bathrooms of any Starbucks in the city
- Plenty of natural light
- Comfortable
- Free WI-FI
author: Asha S.

description: Great starbucks in a great location. One of the only places in the area to get any hydration. My only complaint is the  small restroom. For a hot spot high traffic area, it just has one stall....
author: David W.

description:
I freakin love this Starbucks! It is cute and cozy, there's space to do your work or just sit and enjoy a cup of coffee. They do have free Wi-fi, however it's slow as sh*t, so if you're in a rush don't use it!

The staff is super friendly, I go almost every morning before I head into work. They all know me by name, it's like Cheers. The drinks always taste good and if you don't like it they have no problem remaking it. 

Tip: Avoid going around 9 am and 3 pm, there is almost always a mad rush. After those times, it's smooth sailing.

All in all, I have to say this is by far my favorite Starbucks!
author: Alejandra I.

description:
Since my last review of this Starbucks location (1.5-2 years ago) A LOT has changed! 

I started coming back to this location about 7-8 months ago (and now go everyday). The staff is super friendly and amazing. This is the true Starbucks feel. 

Awesome location, friendly staff, and great atmosphere!

... now if we could only have pumpkin spice year round! :)
author: Marcos M.

description:
This Starbucks is completely different than every other location! 

It turns out, it very much like all the others. But, it is a bit more spacious inside. And the Presidio is a beautiful place to. Like.
author: Steve N.

description:
Im not usually one to complain because I used to work as a server and understand annoying customers but the service I got today from this specific location was TERRIBLE.  The barista that rung me up had good customer service until i went over to grab my drink, my mom wanted water so i kindly asked her if i could also get a cup of water.  The lady barista with the dark hair, in a pony tail, shaved in the back who looked like the white rob schneiders daughter from grown ups WAS A COMPLETE JOKE. It looked like she had smelled dog sh** and it was stuck up her nose cause she would not crack a smile.  She left my drink orders at the end of her counter so I had to reach over to grab my drinks and they didnt even have straws outside, it was behind the glass.

Anyway, she SUCKS at making drinks, my smoothie tasted like straight up crushed ice and she was complaining that the blender did not work well.  Go figure when you toss a bunch of ice with no liquid.  So i went back frustrated to talk to my cashier to tell her to make me a new one and that I wanted someone else to make me a new drink because that barista was terrible.  She apologizes and still goes ahead to ask that same stanky barista to make my drink again.  Luckily, she made it DECENT but her attitude was out of this world that it wasnt even worth it to deal with her ass again.  

I get that people have problems outside of work or maybe at work but PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE don't take it out on customers.  Afterall, you work at starbucks...what makes you think your stupid attitude will get you? Looks like you'll be on the streets soon! 

Overall, nice attitude from all baristas but because of that one stupid barista who doesnt even deserve a job took away the tip for the rest unfortunately. Hope the manager reads this and does something about it!
author: Em C.

description: Can't say enough good about the employees here.  I ordered some boxes of travelers coffee for a meeting and they had it all ready on time perfectly with just the right amount of half and half, sugar and sweetener    Those guys are the bests!
author: Ed W.

description:
me:  Hi, I ordered a chai and you gave me a mocha
barista:  I promise you, it's a chai
me:  do you want to taste it?
barista: no, i don't want to taste it but i promise its a chai. but i'll make you another one. it's a chai with no water, right? soy?
me: yes
barista: see?  i even memorized your drink
me:  [thinking] if you memorized my fucking drink you wouldn't have given me the wrong one.
barista:  here's your drink...(throws the cup sleeve down at me)

So my theory is that the person making the drink was probably walking to work and a big fat bird took a big sloppy shit on her glasses.  Hence, she's having a bad day.  

I get it. We all have bad days, but why are you going to take a shit on your customers because of it?  Do you want me to call your mom and have her come down to give you a hug and a pat on the back?  "There there, things will be alright.  Now turn that frown upside down and go make that coffee."  How's that?  Feel better?  Now stop being so god damn annoying or you might end up having a customer that wont' just walk away but instead throw their drink back in your face!

About this establishment...it's nice. Located in the Presidio where wealthy stay at home moms go for playdates with their infant children.  It's conveniently located in the building where I work so yay for that.  But fuck if having you talked down to is worth the price of convenience.

By the way...you still have bird shit on your glasses.
author: Duckie A.

description:
Plenty of seating!
Free Wifi!
Great views!
Sample drinks every few hours. :)
author: Heidy S.

description:
This is a Starbucks in a beautiful spot. The downside is that the parking lot is controlled by some agro parking attendants. I was meeting some clients for a meeting which ran a little late. Not that long. When I came outside the parking attendant was making a little TOW sign for my motorcycle and was smiling at me like a escapee from a insanasylum. "stick around, you already have a ticket and now you are getting towed"  He lectured me about respecting the rules, etc. The lot was half full at best. 
 Just be careful if you park in the only parking nearby. I guess this was meant to be a private starbucks for the local Presidio folks.
author: Jamie C.

description:
Probably the best Starbucks I've ever been to (and I used to live two blocks from Pike Place in Seattle, the first Starbucks store). The location is perfect if you have a dog and it's far enough off the beaten track that you have plenty of outdoor options when it comes to enjoying your tasty beverage.

The one downside here is that their opening hours are kind of bizarre. There are plenty of people that would go here late in the evening but they seem obsessed with closing early.

Unless you've lived on the moon for the past 10 years there's nothing more I can say about this Starbucks except that this is a good location.
author: Bryan B.

description: This is a pretty typical Starbucks, however, it is located in the beautiful Presidio of SF, so it's basically in a National Park. Lots of tourists go here, so it can have long lines. They always move pretty quickly though. There is also a Yoda fountain nearby due to the proximity to Lucas Arts. The staff is very friendly and they learn your names and your drinks. They always have a well-stock food section as well and super beautiful views if you sit outside at a table.
author: Mylie T.

description:
This is my favorite Starbuck's in the City.  Good coffee!  Awesome service!

I just wish it was open later and longer.  It kinda get crowded but it's a great place to watch the world go by.
author: Jack R.

description:
I ordered in advance for group - box of coffee, pastries, fruit salad - really shouldn't have been hard. Then I confirmed the order 2 days before they were to pick it up.

When the person went to pick it up the counter person's response was along the lines of not knowing anything about that, and that they didn't have that. Someone else looked in a book of scribbles and said "oh yeah, we were supposed to do that for you." so they put it together.

Day 2, same order - they had an order ready, but for some reason they had inflated the order to 3 boxes of coffee (a LOT at ~96 oz each.)  Now, I'm not normally opposed to having extra except that because you pay when you pick up my group was charged for things we never ordered. 

F*ed up both days = dear god, do not order for a group from this place.
author: Lady A.

description: Nice view. Nice staff. Consistently clean, well stocked and appears well run. I come here on the regs and have never had an issue. Typical Starbucks products & pricing. The staff go above & beyond with their customer service, remembering customer names & drink orders. Gorgeous views!!!
author: Cec D.

description: I've been there each day of my vacation with mediocre service but today was by far the worst! Patrick, the cashier, was very rude and condescending. He refused to make me a hot coffee with cream and sugar. He said that's what the condiment bar was for, forgot my food order and when I did get my food it was placed in a ripped bag. My food fell on the ground on my way back to the hotel. Patrick is awful!
author: Bonnie B.

description:
My favorite starbucks in the city! I honestly don't want to write a review because I don't want people to know about this gem!

Inside the Starbucks is spacious and the surrounding view is a beautiful garden, river, fountain you name it. Such breath taking views of the city and away from all the people noise...*cough* aka annoying tourists...

I love coming here to take naps at the garden too. Anyway this is the best place to relax and take a breather!

Note: If you want to find parking, lyon street isn't too bad and most times I can find a spot.
author: Michelle L.

description: This is by far the best Starbucks in the entire world. I mean it. Perfect location, but most of the all the service is outstanding. I can't believe how well-run the place is. It seems like a bunch of young kids at first glance but it's always impeccably clean, the drinks are served fast and always with a smile. They know exactly what they're doing. HUGE kudos to all that work here. Keep up the great work.
author: Alyssa O.

description: Not dog friendly! It was a hot day yesterday and my friend took in the empty metal dog water bowl that sits just outside the door and asked Starbucks to fill it up with water for our dogs. First they said no. They don't give our free dog water. You have to buy it. Then when she asked for the manager and questioned their policy they gave her one plastic cup full of water as a one-time favor. They said the dog bowl was not theirs, and that they would only give customers one free cup of water if they had the cup from them proving they had purchased a drink. Crazy!
author: Valerie L.

description:
One of my favorite Starbucks! Nice staff, and why wouldn't the members be happy? They have an awesome view all day! 

Indoor and outdoor seating, but I recommend bringing earphones/earplugs if you're sound sensitive, as tourists are chatty and people seem to like to hold interviews here.
author: Lana L.

description: Rudest and worst service I have ever experienced at a Starbucks. Handed me my drink with rolling eyes and a back turn. Wow. She must be having a really bad start to the new year.
author: PJ S.

description: This Starbucks is the absolutely the worst! Slowest service every time! This was my 5th and final attempt with this place! Too bad because it probably has one of the best locations in the city
author: Kristi K.

description: My favorite SBUX.  If you've ever read Howard Schultz's book Onward, this staff and environment embody his vision better than any I've seen.  My wife and I love walking over with our dog and relaxing on the outside patio.
author: Shaun F.

description: My most favorite Starbucks ever I can't help it to stop buy it  and they are nice people too
author: Jeselyn J.

description: The staff at this location is great and you can't go wrong with the view.  My only issue is really with the shift to La Boulange food.  The new food is just horrible.  I had one of the new raspberry loaf items and not only was it 1/5 the size of the old lemon pound cakes or banana breads, but the oil literally soaked the napkin that I placed it on before I ate it.  The La Boulange food wouldn't bother me so much if the old items were still on the menu, but now we are forced to eat these subpar menu items.  Bring back the old food in SF!!
author: William B.

description:
-est

Friendliest baristas
Largest glass windows
Serenest views 
Foamiest lattes
Comfiest atmosphere 

Best Starbucks I've ever been to :)
author: Jane L.

description: Think I found my relatively quiet Starbucks!  Was there on a Monday night, and even tho the place was full, it was peaceful, as were the surroundings. It's obvious that this Starbucks serves the busy weekend traffic and the office building(s) around it only.  They close early in case you need to be there some other time, check fist.
author: A W.

description: This Starbucks always has a huge line, so if you're in a rush then I suggest you skip coming here. The problem isn't the customers, it's the service. I come here everyday (work nearby) and my wait is anywhere from 5-15 minutes sometimes. Otherwise it's a large place with good views and tons of seating.
author: Bella S.

description: Great outdoor area, good coffee and free Wifi.  Nice place to stop on the way back to Marin.  Plus the parking is free at Letterman.
author: Albert S.

description: This is a great Starbucks because of the view and outside seating. Same old good Starbucks taste and good service.
author: Nicoletta K.

description: I come here everyday on my lunch break :) the staff members are very polite and always friendly- what a perfect location for Lucas film employees!
author: Amber P.

description:
It is unfathomable how rude the man (blond guy with scruffy beard and ponytail) who took our order was. When I asked to use my Starbucks Rewards Card, the cashier audibly grunted. The total of our drinks were a little over what was on the card so I paid the rest with cash.  Since I had a few bucks I was going to put a few dollars into the tip jar but as I put in the first dollar in, he mumbled " oh...thanks" as he motioned to give me my change but (in my impression - intentionally) missed my hand spilling the change all over the counter. He looked me right in the eye with a smirk and turned away without apologizing as if I dropped the change myself. I have worked in the food service industry a very long time and know this passive aggressive BS when I see it. This was blatant and totally uncalled for.
I realize that for some people - being rude to customers is funny and cool especially tourists but this was plain RUDE. This guy needs to be kicked to the curb so he can see why he should be better to the very people that pay his employer to pay him. I have a hundreds of other places to spend my money in SF - this place will never see my money again. If this is a corporate store the upper management needs to monitor this store and have a serious talk with the GM. If this isn't - then a franchise rep should have a serious discussion about brand representation with this franchisee.
author: A. C.

description:
This is my go-to Starbucks for getting work done free from distractions. Even though the space is pretty small, it's still quieter and has less traffic than most other locations in the city. Most of the people coming in and out work in the building. Electrical outlets for your computer are along the wall or on the floor. 

Minus 1 star for being a Starbucks. 

Tip: There's a parking lot, but you're limited to 10 minutes. Park on Lyon Street (3 hour max) and walk behind the buildings to get there.
author: Robin C.

description:
Located just 50 steps from my desk, this place gets 5 stars because they have a chalk drawing of Admiral Akbar yelling, "Its a frappe"...

I miss Perk Presidio, but this is an excellent replacement...

Great views, great beans, great folks....
author: Rochelle D.

description: Hidden among a beautifully landscaped national park! Relax on the patio, grab some java prior to the Yoda fountain visit, or just realize how awesome it is to have access to one of the prettiest locations for a Starbucks in the entire United States. Across from Presidio Social Club, get a temporary parking permit from the red coat security at Letterman/Lucas Plaza and enjoy the view of the Palace of Fine Arts!
author: Uncle Fishbits Aeneas X.

description:
Hey, this Starbucks is, at times, the only thing breathing life into my career.  It's a stumble from my office, and that's exactly how I get there most mornings.

The folks who work here get to know you, your name, what you drink, and will even spare you the pain of having to order first thing in the morning by pointing to a cup and saying, "The usual"?

My favorite Starbucks in the whole wide World.
author: Doug L.

description: This is one of the best starbucks in the whole SF Bay Area for studying. They are not trying to pump up volume on their music like the other Starbucks sometimes. Comfy seating and friendly staff. Thanks for letting me hang out!
author: Dhruv M.

description:
After living a few weeks in the life of Paris Hilton or some other overrated celebutard, it was nice to detox in the rare SF sunshine.

With noise from the City being absorbed and silenced by the trees (I should be a science teacher), I felt calm sitting outside on the patio and watching rich people stroll by.  Okay, so I don't really know what strolling is, and they probably weren't rich, but everyone knows perception trumps reality, so humor me.

Thanks to the calm University Campus-ish vibe, my tazo tea tasted a little more delicious and my fruit cup a little more fresh, in the way only a child happily raised on pesticides and artificial flavors can understand.

This location is off the beaten path, and no doubt provides a nice escape for Presidio-dwellers.  Since I have trust issues, I was relaxed, but couldn't let myself feel completely at peace.  I kept expecting someone with a gunney sack and duct tape to jump out of the bushes and drag me toward the Bay.  Don't be worried, dear Reader, because I took a drop-in kickboxing class when I was 17, which practically makes me a black belt.  I would have Ralph Macchio'd that predator, applied hand sanitizer, and then finished my scrumptious Starbucks beverage.  

Now THAT would have been a 5-star review.
author: Janney B.

description:
The people who work there are so awesome....(how awesome are they?!?!).

They're so awesome.....that every other Starbucks I go to pales in comparison; that the lattes taste a little bit better with that golden touch.....awesome
author: Erwin O.

description: great place to get away from the traffic, eat a burger at the bowling alley and take a picture with Yoda...too bad Industrial Magic does not open its doors to tourists.
author: Diraj S.

description: i like the caramel macchiato.  Good stuff!
author: Swaggy P.

description:
Was in the freezing misted wind whipped Presidio this past weekend and thought a toasty cup of coffee would hit the spot. Made my way here, it was around 5, only to find the place stone cold closed.  Great.  I don't get the point of this being a chain store if it doesn't keep broader hours then the small time biz it replaced.

I would have updated this to add another star or two if just for the beautiful LDAC scenery and nice seating areas, but back down the stars go for the abbreviated hours (conveniently not posted on the Starbucks web site) and the fact it apparently isn't even a wifi location..
author: GIR ..

description:
Spacious, clean, beautiful beautiful location. I'm not a revolutionary that hates on Starbucks just because it's a big corporation. You know what, i think their coffee is usually as good if not better than most of the independent owned coffee shops in the same price range. You go to any location you can get the same stuff.

AND they keep it clean!

Big ass minus one star for not having free wi-fi. How backward is that for Starbucks? They don't need that to bring people in.
author: Kokoro I.

description:
YAY! Yay! YAY!

I've been waiting with my nose pushed up against the window for this Starbucks location to open, open, open.  

I know there's a bunch of you Starbucks haters out there, so go get your coffee someplace else and leave the yummy lattes for me.  Now my mid afternoon slump can be properly handled as I roll out of my building and right into the welcoming doors of the Presidio Starbucks.... God bless you!
author: Ms. M. M.

description: I really like this Starbucks esp since my good friend John works here. The line is usually pretty short, although the tables and chairs tend to be filled up. My only gripe is that the hours suck...! I understand that the main customers of the Starbucks are the people who work in the surrounding buildings but it would be great if they were open just a tad later.
author: Laura F.

description: A typical Starbucks, in a beautiful setting -- Easy parking, Take your coffee & stroll through the Presidio.
author: Johnna M.

description: Starbucks is a place to relax and to  people watch when you or having a good cup of coffee. It fun to watch people how they percent there self and sometime try to pick up on each other., some of the lines I heard or so funny but you don't want to hurt the other person ego .
author: rachelle t.

description:
What a great Starbucks.

For location as much as anything, this is a good coffee spot.  The George Lucas financed park is right in front of it, and they have nice outdoor seating available that gets late afternoon sun and is shielded from the wind.

This place is also high on my "People Watching" list.  Where else are you going to get such a continual cluster of ILM tech nerds to observe, listen and amuse yourself with?  (I can imagine the google cafeteria might be a close second, but I haven't made my way down there yet.)  Their conversations are fascinating (today's included the efficacy of punching somebody), their fashion: showing their eternal struggle with accepting/rejecting their worship of George Lucas, and their giggling is one of a kind.  
Yes: giggling.

Oh, and the coffee is good too.  It's Starbucks.
Which means it's good unless that's currently uncool to say.  In which case, just pretend it's a Peet's.  Which -- I'm told by my Marina friends -- is always cool to name drop.
author: Andy C.

description: Yes, this is good for a Starbucks. Nice location. But -1 for parking. You get 20 minutes free (on a Sunday!) and poor signage means good luck getting out by then. We ended up 21 minutes which cost $5. Kinds stupid.
author: Moe R.

description: Had no idea about this Starbucks because its so hidden! Beautiful little spot in the presidido and best of all free WiFi!! I've been to Starbucks who claim to have WiFi, but before getting it you have to jump through hoops online for codes and stuff. This place gives free WiFi no strings attached! AND, there's a beautiful little park and lake out front. So peaceful while sipping a caramel macchiato.
author: Sarah R.

description: Best StarBucks after the one in Tokyo Shibuya.  Maybe i am just biased.  Anyways,  If you see the forecast in sf is going to be in the 70's(which is rare), grab your blanket, buy whatever drink you like, pack a picnic basket, and take a nap in the garden with a view of the palace of fine art's dome.  short walk to crissy fields and marina green.
author: Tim K.

description: Beautiful location with Letterman Pond just a few steps away. I go here when I need a break from the home office. Free WiFi and lots of seating. Cannot ask for a better view of the GGB. All within walking distance from my place. Lucky me.
author: Alesha C.

description:
You know what? I'm pleasantly pleased with the new Starbucks that has encroached upon the Presidio grounds. They've replaced the old Perk Presidio (miss you guys! A lot!) but Starbucks has since stepped up to the plate with some real caramel sauce (without charging me extra for it!).


NB: You do however, have to request for whole milk instead of the default 2% milk if you want it.

NB2: They don't take the LDAC meal card so don't try it.

NB3: Those donuts aren't really from Top Pot.... I have had Top Pot donuts and the ones in the case aren't them! :P
author: dj z.

description: On my way to sports basement ugh I got lost and found a fabulous location with sweethearts working the store.  Check it out if you are near That part of town.  Off to buy my hubby some running shoes
author: Roni R.

description: I love this starbucks! I have been going here for many years and have always had excellent service. All of the staff are super-friendly and you are always greeted with a smile. Its also not too crowded because its tucked away in the presidio, so its a nice place to get away and read a book, do some work, or just chill out.
author: Charlotte P.

description: Who knew that there is a Starbucks near by the old Letterman Hospital, well it is the  Letterman Digital Arts Center now.  I worked in the Presidio for three years and I didn't know that we had a Starbucks. Any whoo I went in with my co worker and I bought the pumpkin bread. I asked the workers if lemon or pumpkin bread was better, it was a split decision for them too. I got the pumpkin bread though and it was DELICIOUS! It was soo jamm packed full of pumpkin flavor! Kinda like a pumpkin pie but without the crust! This place seems like a nice place to chill, relax, study, etc.
author: Janet Z.

description:
The staff and management at the Starbucks in the Presidio are and have been professional, fun, interesting, and just great.  

The Presidio Starbucks has  a nice ambience .....very comfortable.  Highly recommended.
author: Charles L.

description: I love this Starbucks - sometimes there's a line but hey, you know what you're getting! The garden that surrounds it, and the Yoda fountain nearby makes it my favorite Starbucks ever.
author: CM P.

description: Location location location!  (Did I mention the location?)  I call this place "Secret Starbucks" because it's off the beaten path.  I almost don't want to write this review because I don't want the word to get out about this place.  Shhhhhh!!!
author: Barefoot B.

description: Great Location. Inside or out, enjoy the beauty of grounds designed by a world renown landscape architect while you enjoy your drink of choice on the Digital Arts campus setting. Indoors has comfortable seating, wi-fi, plugs for some computers, music. Not as crowded as the common spots. Or take a walk on the campus or in the Presidio and find a picknic table or a bench for more privacy and solitude.
author: joe g.

description: I'm reviewing a Starbucks.  This Starbucks replaced a shop called Perk Presidio -- and, as near as I can tell, is doing 100x the business.  I'm not a coffee person, and I don't own any SBUX -- so, it's weird for me to give it such high marks.  I'm just thrilled I can buy a donut on the Letterman campus -- that's all!
author: Tim G.

description: Yes yes, I know it's just a Starbucks, but this place is seriously a hidden gem.  Floor to ceiling windows, outdoor patio with an amazing view of the Palace of Fine Arts, lots of big armchairs, power outlets set into the floor, quiet clientele.  My only complaint is the lack of free wireless (it's AT&T paid, like all Starbucks).
author: Sarah B.

description: One of the prettiest locations of all the Starbucks, plus indoor and outdoor options, soft and hard seating, friendly baristas, large clean bathrooms without combination locks.  Now if SBUX would only get with the program and serve vegan donuts, cookies, etc., the way Philz, Peets, Local 123, Borderlands Cafe, Greenhouse Cafe all do.
author: Bob G.

description: Never thought I'd review a starbucks...but just discovered this location across the street from chez moi.  Outdoor heated patio, big bright windows overlooking Presidio, Palace of Fine Arts, plenty of big comfy chairs, regular tables and chair. And, a chaise which I am parked in as I type. Who knew?
author: Angela N.

description:
Quick review:
Plus:
+ terrific environment
+ terrific views
+ excellent outdoor seating
+ lots of outlets
+ 3 hr parking near liverpool lil's

Minus:
- holy crap, it's warmer outside (on a foggy day) than inside this place.  There must be a meat locker somewhere in here - FREEZING inside.  I've asked them to ease up and they try but doesn't seem to work/help.
- music is blasted so everyone talks even louder. 

Overall, a great place but just frustrating from a work-in-a-cafe-situation as there's great seating / outlets but you gotta pack a sweater and wear earplugs or something.
author: Jonathan H.

description: The folks here are so friendly and greet me everyday with a smile. They make my morning! Carol is a great manager. :)
author: Kell E.
